column3: I The SME Instrument was set up under the Horizon 2020 research framework
column4: I MVĮ priemonė buvo nustatyta pagal bendrąją mokslinių tyrimų programą

column4: „Horizontas 2020“, siekiant remti inovacijas mažosiose ir vidutinėse įmonėse (MVĮ). Jos

column4: asocijuotųjų šalių MVĮ, kurios parodo didelius užmojus vystytis, augti ir vykdyti veiklą

column4: inovacijų ekosistema ir MVĮ skaičius šalyje;

column3: existence of a national strategy on the SME-I;
column4: parengta nacionalinė MVĮ-P strategija;

column3: effort made to promote the SME-I; and
column4: įdėtos pastangos skatinti MVĮ-P;

column3: support provided by NCPs and the EEN.

column3: Conclusions and recommendations
column4: Išvados ir rekomendacijos

column3: We found that the SME Instrument provides effective support to SMEs in
column4: Nustatėme, kad MVĮ priemone suteikiama veiksminga parama MVĮ rengiant

column3: developing their innovation projects and that having the EU branding helps companies
column4: savo inovacijų projektus ir kad ES prekės ženklo turėjimas padeda įmonėms pritraukti

column3: to attract additional investment. However, links have not been established with EUbacked financial instruments that could help beneficiaries scale-up and bring
column4: papildomų investicijų. Tačiau nebuvo sukurtos sąsajos su ES remiamomis finansinėmis

column3: innovation projects to market. Both Phases 1 and 2 of the instrument provide effective
column4: priemonėmis, kurios galėjo padėti paramos gavėjams plėstis ir pateikti inovacijų

column3: support to SMEs, though Phase 1 incurs disproportionally high administrative costs.
column4: projektus rinkai. Tiek 1, tiek 2 priemonės etapu teikiama veiksminga parama MVĮ, nors

column3: The instrument is competently managed by the Commission. The high number of
column4: etape patiriamos neproporcingai didelės administracinės išlaidos. Šią priemonę

column3: resubmissions and the limited resources have hindered the selection procedure and
column4: kompetentingai valdo Komisija. Didelis pakartotinai pateikiamų paraiškų skaičius ir

column3: cultural sites, but coordination with funding arrangements is limited
An appropriate framework for EU investments in cultural sites needs effective
coordination arrangements between the different policies contributing to the
promotion of cultural sites. Coordinated action within the Commission can ensure
complementarities between EU funds and guarantee an efficient use of financial
resources to develop the proposed initiatives.

column3: The importance of the ERDF framework can be seen in the cultural strategies of
the three Member States we visited. In Poland, the cultural strategy considers culture
as a means of achieving the economic and social cohesion sought by the ERDF. In Italy,
the government developed a national funding programme to complement the national
ERDF OP on culture 32 with the same objectives and funding criteria. In Portugal, the
Commission requested EU funding to follow a mapping exercise, where the needs for
investing in cultural sites are analysed and priorities for investment identified.
column4: Programma di Azione e Coesione Complementare al PON Cultura e Sviluppo 2014–2020.
